players.name: Bob
memory: Diana: "I am not the one who killed Alice. I believe we should focus on finding the real culprit and not accuse each other without solid evidence."
Charlie: "Let's focus on gathering evidence and questioning each other carefully. I don't want to make any accusations without solid proof."
Diana: "I have an alibi for the night of Alice's death. I was at the outskirts of the town, gathering herbs for my potions. Let's work together to find the real killer."
You: "I think we should question Charlie about his whereabouts during the night of Alice's death. He hasn't given us any information yet, and it would be good to know if he has an alibi."
Votes: Bob voted for Diana (the vote was cast randomly because of a failed format), Charlie voted for Bob (the vote was cast randomly because of a failed format), Diana voted for Charlie
